document.heading: Fiscal Year 1998 Revised Budget Support Act of 1998

history.narrative: Law 12-60, the “Fiscal Year 1998 Revised Budget Support Act of 1998,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-353, which was referred to the Committee of the Whole. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on September 8, 1997, and October 7, 1997, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 24, 1997, it was assigned Act No. 12-191 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-60 became effective on March 20, 1998.

section.heading: Written procedures for evaluating facilities needs.
section.text: The District of Columbia Public Schools shall develop and submit for Council approval by November 1, 1997, written procedures outlining an ongoing process for evaluating facilities needs, to include:

para.text: Annual community input and deliberations; and
Annual demographic projections based on census, economic development (which shall include housing starts), and other factors.

annoGroup.heading: Temporary Addition of Section
annoGroup.annotation: Section 1301 of D.C. Law 12-59 added § 31-2218 [1981 Ed.].
Section 2001(b) of D.C. Law 12-59 provided that the act shall expire after 225 days of its having taken effect.
Section 2002 of D.C. Law 12-59 provided that the act shall apply as of October 1, 1997.

annoGroup.heading: Emergency Legislation
annoGroup.annotation: For temporary addition of section, see § 1301 of the Fiscal Year 1998 Revised Budget Support Emergency Act of 1997 (D.C. Act 12-152, October 17, 1997, 44 DCR 6196), and § 1301 of the Fiscal Year 1998 Revised Budget Support Congressional Review Emergency Act of 1997 (D.C. Act 12-239, January 13, 1998, 45 DCR 508).
Section 2002 of D.C. Act 12-152 provided for the application of the act.

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.annotation: Application of Law 12-60: Section 2002 of D.C. Law 12-60 provided that the act shall apply as of October 1, 1997.

section.heading: Community input and demographic analysis in annual capital request.
section.text: The District of Columbia Public Schools shall submit annually with its capital request a report that details how the capital request reflects the required community input and demographic analysis.

annoGroup.heading: Temporary Addition of Section
annoGroup.annotation: Section 1302 of D.C. Law 12-59 added § 31-2219 [1981 Ed.].
Section 2001(b) of D.C. Law 12-59 provided that the act shall expire after 225 days of its having taken effect.
Section 2002 of D.C. Law 12-59 provided that the act shall apply as of October 1, 1997.

annoGroup.heading: Emergency Legislation
annoGroup.annotation: For temporary addition of section, see § 1302 of the Fiscal Year 1998 Revised Budget Support Emergency Act of 1997 (D.C. Act 12-152, October 17, 1997, 44 DCR 6196), and § 1302 of the Fiscal Year 1998 Revised Budget Support Congressional Review Emergency Act of 1997 (D.C. Act 12-239, January 13, 1998, 45 DCR 508).

section.heading: Establishment of the 21st Century Public School Information Technology Program.

annoGroup.heading: Temporary Addition of Section
annoGroup.annotation: Sections 1401 to 1406 of D.C. Law 12-59 enacted §§ 31-2521 to 31-2525, comprising subchapter II of Chapter 25 of Title 31 1981 Ed. .
Section 2001(b) of D.C. Law 12-59 provided that the act shall expire after 225 days of its having taken effect.

annoGroup.heading: Emergency Legislation
annoGroup.annotation: For temporary addition of subchapter II, see §§ 1401 to 1406 of the Fiscal Year 1998 Revised Budget Support Emergency Act of 1997 (D.C. Act 12-152, October 17, 1997, 44 DCR 6196); and see §§ 1401 to 1406 of the Fiscal Year 1998 Revised Budget Support Congressional Review Emergency Act of 1997 (D.C. Act 12-239, January 13, 1998, 45 DCR 508).
Section 2002 of D.C. Act 12-152 provided for the application of the act.

annoGroup.heading: Short Title
annoGroup.annotation: 21st Century Public School Information Technology Program Act of 1997: Section 1401 of D.C. Law 12-60 provided that title XIV of the act may be cited as the “21st Century Public School Information Technology Program Act of 1997.”

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.annotation: Editor’s Note Section 1406 of D.C. Law 12-60 provided that this chapter shall expire in 4 years after March 20, 1998. Sections 38-2201 to 38-2205 expired effective March 21, 2002.

annoGroup.heading: Temporary Addition of Section
annoGroup.annotation: See Historical and Statutory Notes following § 38-2201.

annoGroup.heading: Emergency Legislation
annoGroup.annotation: For temporary addition of subchapter, see note to § 38-2201.

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes

annoGroup.heading: Temporary Addition of Section
annoGroup.annotation: D.C. Law 12-59, title XVIII, § 1802 ( 44 DCR 7356), eff. March 20, 1998, provided for the temporary addition of this section.
Section 2001(b) of D.C. Law 12-59 provided for expiration “after 225 days of its having taken effect.”
Section 2002 of D.C. Law 12-59 provided: “Sec. 2002. This act shall apply as of October 1, 1997.”

annoGroup.heading: Emergency Legislation
annoGroup.annotation: For temporary repeal of section, see § 1502(a) of the Fiscal Year 1999 Budget Support Emergency Act of 1998 (D.C. Act 12-401, July 13, 1998, 45 DCR 4794) and § 1502(a) of the Fiscal Year 1999 Budget Support Congressional Review Emergency Act of 1998 (D.C. Act 12-564, January 12, 1999, 46 DCR 669).
For temporary (90-day) amendment of section, see § 1502(a) of the Fiscal Year 1999 Budget Support Congressional Review Emergency Act of 1999 (D.C. Act 13-41, March 31, 1999, 46 DCR 3446).

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.text: D.C. Law 12-60, title XVIII, § 1802 ( 44 DCR 7378), eff. March 20, 1998, added this section. Section 2002 of D.C. Law 12-60 provided: “Sec. 2002. This act shall apply as of October 1, 1997.”
Application of D.C. Law 12-175: Section 1904 of D.C. Law 12-175 provided that the act shall apply as of October 1, 1998.

Section 2001(b) of D.C. Law 12-59 provided the act shall expire after 225 days of its having taken effect.

Act 12-401, July 13, 1998, 45 DCR 4794), and § 1502(b) of the Fiscal Year 1999 Budget Support Congressional Review Emergency Act of 1998 (D.C. Act 12-564, January 12, 1999, 46 DCR 669).
For temporary (90-day) amendment of section, see § 1502(b) of the Fiscal Year 1999 Budget Support Congressional Review Emergency Act of 1999 (D.C. Act 13-41, March 31, 1999, 46 DCR 3446).
For temporary (90-day) amendment of section, see § 1502(c) of the Fiscal Year 1999 Budget Support Congressional Review Emergency Act of 1999 (D.C. Act 13-41, March 31, 1999, 46 DCR 3446).

para.heading: Fees credited to the special account.

annoGroup.heading: Temporary Amendment of Section
annoGroup.annotation: Section 2 of D.C. Law 14-86, the “Protections from Predatory Lending and Mortgage Foreclosure Improvements Temporary Amendment Act of 2001”, effective March 19, 2002, provided that D.C. Law 13-263 shall not apply beginning November 6, 2001, through March 6, 2002.
Section 4(b) of D.C. Law 14-86 provided that the act shall expire after 225 days of its having taken effect.

annoGroup.heading: Temporary Addition of Section
annoGroup.annotation: For temporary addition of sections, see notes following § 26-602.

annoGroup.heading: Emergency Legislation
annoGroup.annotation: For temporary amendment of section, see § 1502(c) of the Fiscal Year 1999 Budget Support Emergency Act of 1998 (D.C. Act 12-401, July 13, 1998, 45 DCR 4794) and § 1502(c) of the Fiscal Year 1999 Budget Support Congressional Review Emergency Act of 1999 (D.C. Act 12-564, January 12, 1999, 46 DCR 669).

Section 2 of Act 14-188, the “Protections from Predatory Lending and Mortgage Foreclosure Improvements Emergency Amendment Act”, deemed approved Nov. 27, 2001, without the signature of the Mayor, provided that D.C. Law 13-263 shall not apply beginning November 6, 2001, through March 6, 2002.
For temporary (90 day) amendment of section, see § 601(b) of Home Loan Protection Emergency Act of 2002 (D.C. Act 14-295, March 1, 2002, 49 DCR 2534).

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.text: Application of Law 12-60: See Historical and Statutory Notes following § 26-602.
Application of D.C. Law 12-175: See Historical and Statutory Notes following § 26-601.

annoGroup.annotation: For temporary (225 day) amendment of section, see § 2(x) of Public Assistance Temporary Amendment Act of 1998 (D.C. Law 12-130, July 24, 1998, law notification 45 DCR 6501).
For temporary (225 day) repeal of section, see § 2(p) of Self-Sufficiency Promotion Temporary Amendment Act of 1998 (D.C. Law 12-230, April 20, 1999, law notification 46 DCR 4143).
